understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if the _journalSerializer variable is not null, and if so, it returns that object. Otherwise, it creates a new JavaSerializer object and returns it.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining which Serializer object to use. It checks if a custom Serializer object has been set (_journalSerializer) and if not, it falls back to using the default JavaSerializer. This method is crucial for configuring the serialization behavior of the Prevayler system.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is used in the create() method to create a Prevayler instance. It is passed as a parameter to the PrevaylerImpl constructor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is triggered whenever a new Prevayler instance is created using the create() method.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how transactions are handled and copied within the Prevayler instance. Depending on the value set for _transactionDeepCopyMode, it can affect the memory usage and performance of the system.
